heading: Births
txt: David Chalmers, Australian philosopher and academic

entities.title: David Chalmers
entities.description: David John Chalmers is an Australian philosopher and cognitive scientist specializing in the areas of philosophy of mind and philosophy of language. He is a Professor of Philosophy and Neural Science at New York University, as well as co-director of NYU's Center for Mind, Brain and Consciousness. In 2013, he was elected a Fellow of the American Academy of Arts & Sciences.

heading: Births
txt: David Filo, American businessman, co-founded Yahoo!

entities.title: Yahoo!
entities.description: Yahoo! is an American web services provider. It is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California and is owned by Verizon Media, pending sale to investment funds managed by Apollo Global Management.

heading: Births
txt: Mike Portnoy, American drummer and songwriter

entities.title: Mike Portnoy
entities.description: Michael Stephen Portnoy is an American musician and songwriter who is the current drummer for the Neal Morse Band and supergroups Flying Colors, Transatlantic, The Winery Dogs, Liquid Tension Experiment, Metal Allegiance and Sons of Apollo. Portnoy is primarily known as the former drummer, backing vocalist, and a co-founder of the progressive metal band Dream Theater. In September 2010, Portnoy an

heading: Births
txt: Julia Morris, Australian entertainer

entities.title: Julia Morris
entities.description: Julia Carolyn Margaret Morris is an Australian comedian, television presenter, actress, writer and producer who has worked extensively in Australian television and radio, touring the country with her solo comedy shows. She relocated to the United Kingdom in 2000, appearing on British television, then returned to Australia in 2007. She lived on the Central Coast for her childhood.

heading: Births
txt: Yelena Välbe, Russian skier and manager

heading: Births
txt: Roman Virastyuk, Ukrainian shot putter

heading: Births
txt: Will Hodgman, Australian politician, 45th Premier of Tasmania

entities.title: Will Hodgman
entities.description: William Edward Felix Hodgman is an Australian diplomat and former politician who has been the High Commissioner of Australia to Singapore since February 2021. He was the 45th Premier of Tasmania and a member for the Division of Franklin in the Tasmanian House of Assembly from the 2002 state election until his resignation in January 2020. He became premier following the 2014 state election, having

entities.title: Premier of Tasmania
entities.description: The Premier of Tasmania is the head of the executive government in the Australian state of Tasmania. By convention, the leader of the party or political grouping which has majority support in the House of Assembly is invited by the Governor of Tasmania to be Premier and principal adviser.

heading: Births
txt: Sarantuya, Mongolian soprano

entities.title: Sarantuya
entities.description: Sarantuya (Mongolian: Батмөнхийн Сарантуяа, known simply as Saraa, is a Mongolian mezzo-soprano singer who has been a major figure in the pop music scene of the Mongol people since the late 1980s. She is still very popular among the Mongolian population, and is recognized as the queen of Mongolian pop music. Saraa is the highest-selling Mongolian artist of all time, with hits like "Torson Odriin B

heading: Births
txt: Avishai Cohen, Israeli singer-songwriter and bassist

heading: Births
txt: Carla Geurts, Dutch swimmer, physiologist, and academic

entities.title: Carla Geurts
entities.description: Carla Geurts is a former Dutch freestyle swimmer who competed at the 1996 Olympic Games in Atlanta, Georgia, and the 2000 Olympic Games in Sydney, Australia for the Netherlands. Geurts won three silver medals during her career at the European Swimming Championships. She retired in 2001, after the 2001 World Aquatics Championships in Fukuoka.

heading: Births
txt: Carmen Electra, American model and actress

entities.title: Carmen Electra
entities.description: Tara Leigh Patrick, known professionally as Carmen Electra, is an American actress, model, singer, and media personality. She began her career as a singer after moving to Minneapolis, where she met Prince, who produced her self-titled debut studio album, released in 1993. Electra began glamour modeling in 1996 with frequent appearances in Playboy magazine, before relocating to Los Angeles, where s

heading: Deaths
txt: Cædwalla, king of Wessex (b. 659)

entities.title: Cædwalla of Wessex
entities.description: Cædwalla was the King of Wessex from approximately 685 until he abdicated in 688. His name is derived from the Welsh Cadwallon. He was exiled from Wessex as a youth and during this period gathered forces and attacked the South Saxons, killing their king, Æthelwealh, in what is now Sussex. Cædwalla was unable to hold the South Saxon territory, however, and was driven out by Æthelwealh's ealdormen.

entities.title: Wessex
entities.description: Wessex was an Anglo-Saxon kingdom in the south of Great Britain, from 519 until England was unified by Æthelstan in 927.

heading: Deaths
txt: Taichō, Japanese monk (b. 682)

entities.title: Taichō
entities.description: Taichō  was a shugendō monk in Nara period Japan. He was raised in Echizen Province, which was in the southern portion of present-day Fukui Prefecture. He was the second son of Mikami Yasuzumi (三神安角). He is said to be the first person to reach the top of Mount Haku in neighboring Kaga Province and other peaks in the Ryōhaku Mountains.

heading: Deaths
txt: Xi Zong, Chinese emperor (b. 862)

entities.title: Emperor Xizong of Tang
entities.description: Emperor Xizong of Tang, né Li Yan, later name changed to Li Xuan, was an emperor of the Tang dynasty of China. He reigned from 873 to 888. He was the fifth son of his predecessor Emperor Yizong and was the elder brother of his successor Emperor Zhaozong. His reign saw his realm overrun by the great agrarian rebellions led by Wang Xianzhi and Huang Chao, and while both were eventually defeated, by

heading: Deaths
txt: Peter Bartholomew (b. 1061)

entities.title: Peter Bartholomew
entities.description: Peter Bartholomew was a French soldier and mystic who was part of the First Crusade as part of the army of Raymond of Saint-Gilles. Peter was initially a servant to William, Lord of Cunhlat.

heading: Deaths
txt: Antipope Victor IV

entities.title: Antipope Victor IV (1159–1164)
entities.description: Victor IV was elected as a Ghibelline antipope in 1159, following the death of Pope Adrian IV and the election of Alexander III. His election was supported by the Emperor Frederick Barbarossa. He took the name Victor IV, not accounting for Antipope Victor IV of 1138, whose holding of the papal office was deemed illegitimate.

heading: Deaths
txt: Richard de Clare, 2nd Earl of Pembroke, English-Irish politician, Lord Chief Justice of Ireland (b. 1130)

entities.title: Richard de Clare, 2nd Earl of Pembroke
entities.description: Richard de Clare, 2nd Earl of Pembroke, Lord of Leinster, Justiciar of Ireland, also known as Richard FitzGilbert, was an Anglo-Norman nobleman notable for his leading role in the Anglo-Norman invasion of Ireland. Like his father, Richard fitz Gilbert has since become commonly known by his nickname Strongbow, which may be a mistranscription or mistranslation of "Striguil".

entities.title: Lord Chief Justice of Ireland
entities.description: The Court of King's Bench was one of the senior courts of common law in Ireland. It was a mirror of the Court of King's Bench in England. The Lord Chief Justice was the most senior judge in the court, and the second most senior Irish judge under English rule and later when Ireland became part of the United Kingdom. Additionally, for a brief period between 1922 and 1924, the Lord Chief Justice of I

heading: Deaths
txt: Güyük Khan, Mongol ruler, 3rd Great Khan of the Mongol Empire (b. 1206)

entities.title: Güyük Khan
entities.description: Güyük was the third Khagan-Emperor of the Mongol Empire, the eldest son of Ögedei Khan and a grandson of Genghis Khan. He reigned from 1246 to 1248.

entities.title: Great Khan
entities.description: Khagan or Qaghan is a title of imperial rank in the Turkic, Mongolic and some other languages, equal to the status of emperor and someone who rules a khaganate (empire). The female equivalent is Khatun.

heading: Deaths
txt: Hōjō Tokimune, regent of Japan (b. 1251)

entities.title: Hōjō Tokimune
entities.description: Hōjō Tokimune  of the Hōjō clan was the eighth shikken of the Kamakura shogunate, known for leading the Japanese forces against the invasion of the Mongols and for spreading Zen Buddhism. He was the eldest son of Tokiyori, fifth shikken (regent) of the Kamakura shogunate and de facto ruler of Japan. From birth, Hojo was seen as the tokuso (head) of the clan Hojo and rigorously groomed to become hi

heading: Deaths
txt: Pope Clement V (b. 1264)

entities.title: Pope Clement V
entities.description: Pope Clement V, born Raymond Bertrand de Got, was head of the Catholic Church and ruler of the Papal States from 5 June 1305 to his death in April 1314. He is remembered for suppressing the order of the Knights Templar and allowing the execution of many of its members. Pope Clement V was the pope who moved the Papacy from Rome to Avignon, ushering in the period known as the Avignon Papacy.

heading: Deaths
txt: Simon Rinalducci, Italian Augustinian friar

entities.title: Simon Rinalducci
entities.description: Simon Rinalducci of Todi was a famous Italian Augustinian friar and preacher of the 13th century.

heading: Deaths
txt: Zhengde, Chinese emperor (b. 1491)

entities.title: Zhengde Emperor
entities.description: The Zhengde Emperor, who was the 11th Emperor of the Ming dynasty, reigned from 1505 to 1521.

heading: Deaths
txt: Elizabeth Barton, English nun and martyr (b. 1506)

entities.title: Elizabeth Barton
entities.description: Sister Elizabeth Barton, known as "The Nun of Kent", "The Holy Maid of London", "The Holy Maid of Kent" and later "The Mad Maid of Kent", was an English Catholic nun. She was executed as a result of her prophecies against the marriage of King Henry VIII of England to Anne Boleyn.

heading: Deaths
txt: Johannes Bugenhagen, German priest and theologian (b. 1485)

entities.title: Johannes Bugenhagen
entities.description: Johannes Bugenhagen, also called Doctor Pomeranus by Martin Luther, introduced the Protestant Reformation in the Duchy of Pomerania and Denmark in the 16th century. Among his major accomplishments was organization of Lutheran churches in Northern Germany and Scandinavia. He has also been called the second Apostle of the North.

heading: Deaths
txt: Christoph Demantius, German composer and poet (b. 1567)

entities.title: Christoph Demantius
entities.description: Johann Christoph Demantius was a German composer, music theorist, writer and poet. He was an exact contemporary of Monteverdi, and represented a transitional phase in German Lutheran music from the polyphonic Renaissance style to the early Baroque.

heading: Deaths
txt: Lancelot Addison, English clergyman and educator (b. 1632)

entities.title: Lancelot Addison
entities.description: The Reverend Lancelot Addison was an English writer and Church of England clergyman. He was born at Crosby Ravensworth in Westmorland. He was educated at the Queen's College, Oxford.

heading: Deaths
txt: Chief Pontiac, American tribal leader (b. 1720)

entities.title: Chief Pontiac
entities.description: Pontiac or Obwandiyag was an Odawa war chief known for his role in the war named for him, from 1763 to 1766 leading Native Americans in an armed struggle against the British in the Great Lakes region due to, among other reasons, dissatisfaction with British policies. It followed the British victory in the French and Indian War, the American front of the Seven Years' War. Pontiac's importance in th

heading: Deaths
txt: John Abernethy, English surgeon and anatomist (b. 1764)

entities.title: John Abernethy (surgeon)
entities.description: John Abernethy FRS was an English surgeon. He is popularly remembered today for having given his name to the Abernethy biscuit, a coarse-meal baked good meant to aid digestion.

heading: Deaths
txt: William Tite, English architect, designed the Royal Exchange (b. 1798)

entities.title: William Tite
entities.description: Sir William Tite was an English architect who served as President of the Royal Institute of British Architects. He was particularly associated with various London buildings, with railway stations and cemetery projects. He was a Member of Parliament from 1855 until his death.

entities.title: Royal Exchange, London
entities.description: The Royal Exchange in London was founded in the 16th century by the merchant Sir Thomas Gresham on the suggestion of his factor Richard Clough to act as a centre of commerce for the City of London. The site was provided by the City of London Corporation and the Worshipful Company of Mercers, who still jointly own the freehold. It is trapezoidal in shape and is flanked by Cornhill and Threadneedle

heading: Deaths
txt: Alexander H. Bailey, American lawyer, judge, and politician (b. 1817)

entities.title: Alexander H. Bailey
entities.description: Alexander Hamilton Bailey was an American politician, a United States Representative and judge from New York.

heading: Deaths
txt: William Burges, English architect and designer (b. 1827)

entities.title: William Burges
entities.description: William Burges was an English architect and designer. Among the greatest of the Victorian art-architects, he sought in his work to escape from both nineteenth-century industrialisation and the Neoclassical architectural style and re-establish the architectural and social values of a utopian medieval England. Burges stands within the tradition of the Gothic Revival, his works echoing those of the P

heading: Deaths
txt: Charles-François-Frédéric, marquis de Montholon-Sémonville, French general and diplomat, French ambassador to the United States (b. 1814)

entities.title: Charles-François-Frédéric, marquis de Montholon-Sémonville
entities.description: Charles François Frédéric de Montholon-Sémonville was a French senator, diplomat, and French ambassador to the United States, from 1864 to 1866.

entities.title: List of French ambassadors to the United States
entities.description: The French ambassador to the United States is the diplomatic representation of the French Republic to the United States. They reside in Washington, D.C.. The current ambassador is Philippe Étienne.

heading: Deaths
txt: Muhammad Sharif Pasha, Greek-Egyptian politician, 2nd Prime Minister of Egypt (b. 1826)

entities.title: Muhammad Sharif Pasha
entities.description: Mohamed Sherif Pasha GCSI (1826–1887) was an Egyptian statesman of Turkish origin. He served as Prime Minister of Egypt three times during his career. His first term was between April 7, 1879 and August 18, 1879. His second term was served from September 14, 1881 to February 4, 1882. His final term was served between August 21, 1882 and January 7, 1884.

entities.title: Prime Minister of Egypt
entities.description: The Prime Minister of Egypt is the head of the Egyptian government.

heading: Deaths
txt: Joseph Wolf, German ornithologist and illustrator (b. 1820)

entities.title: Joseph Wolf
entities.description: Joseph Wolf was a German artist who specialized in natural history illustration. He moved to the British Museum in 1848 and became the preferred illustrator for explorers and naturalists including David Livingstone, Alfred Russel Wallace and Henry Walter Bates. Wolf depicted animals accurately in lifelike postures and is considered one of the great pioneers of wildlife art. Sir Edwin Landseer thou

heading: Deaths
txt: Joaquim de Sousa Andrade, Brazilian poet and educator (b. 1833)

entities.title: Joaquim de Sousa Andrade
entities.description: Joaquim de Sousa Andrade, better known by his pseudonym Sousândrade, was a Brazilian poet, adept of the "Condorist" movement. His poetry, exceedingly innovative for the time it was published, is now considered an early example of Symbolism and Modernism in Brazil.

heading: Deaths
txt: Bram Stoker, Anglo-Irish novelist and critic, created Count Dracula (b. 1847)

entities.title: Bram Stoker
entities.description: Abraham "Bram" Stoker was an Irish author, best known today for his 1897 Gothic horror novel Dracula. During his lifetime, he was better known as the personal assistant of actor Sir Henry Irving and business manager of the Lyceum Theatre, which Irving owned.

entities.title: Count Dracula
entities.description: Count Dracula is the title character of Bram Stoker's 1897 gothic horror novel Dracula. He is considered to be both the prototypical and the archetypal vampire in subsequent works of fiction. He is also depicted in the novel to have been the origin of werewolf legends. Some aspects of the character are believed to have been inspired by the 15th-century Wallachian Prince Vlad the Impaler, who was a

heading: Deaths
txt: Karl Ferdinand Braun, German-American physicist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1850)

entities.title: Karl Ferdinand Braun
entities.description: Karl Ferdinand Braun was a German electrical engineer, inventor, physicist and Nobel laureate in physics. Braun contributed significantly to the development of radio and television technology: he shared the 1909 Nobel Prize in Physics with Guglielmo Marconi "for their contributions to the development of wireless telegraphy".

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Physics is a yearly award given by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences for those who have made the most outstanding contributions for mankind in the field of physics. It is one of the five Nobel Prizes established by the will of Alfred Nobel in 1895 and awarded since 1901; the others being the Nobel Prize in Chemistry, Nobel Prize in Literature, Nobel Peace Prize, and Nobel Pr

heading: Deaths
txt: Enrique Simonet, Spanish painter and educator (b. 1866)

entities.title: Enrique Simonet
entities.description: Enrique Simonet Lombardo was a Spanish painter.

heading: Deaths
txt: Prince Henry of Prussia (b. 1862)

entities.title: Prince Henry of Prussia (1862–1929)
entities.description: Prince Albert William Henry of Prussia was a younger brother of German Emperor William II and a Prince of Prussia. He was also a grandson of Queen Victoria. A career naval officer, he held various commands in the Imperial German Navy and eventually rose to the rank of Grand Admiral and Generalinspekteur der Marine.

heading: Deaths
txt: Sir Cosmo Duff-Gordon, 5th Baronet, Scottish-English fencer and businessman (b. 1862)

entities.title: Sir Cosmo Duff-Gordon, 5th Baronet
entities.description: Sir Cosmo Edmund Duff-Gordon, 5th Baronet DL was a prominent Scottish landowner and sportsman, best known for the controversy surrounding his escape from the sinking of the RMS Titanic.

heading: Deaths
txt: Giuseppe Peano, Italian mathematician and philosopher (b. 1858)

entities.title: Giuseppe Peano
entities.description: Giuseppe Peano was an Italian mathematician and glottologist. The author of over 200 books and papers, he was a founder of mathematical logic and set theory, to which he contributed much notation. The standard axiomatization of the natural numbers is named the Peano axioms in his honor. As part of this effort, he made key contributions to the modern rigorous and systematic treatment of the method

heading: Deaths
txt: John Cameron, Scottish footballer and manager (b. 1872)

entities.title: John Cameron (footballer, born 1872)
entities.description: John Cameron was a Scottish footballer and manager. He played as a forward for Queen's Park, Everton and Scotland and was noted as an effective goal-maker and goalscorer. In 1899 he became player-manager at Tottenham Hotspur and guided them to victory in the 1901 FA Cup. As a result, they became the only club outside the English Football League to win the competition. In 1898 he became the first s

heading: Deaths
txt: Lucy, Lady Duff-Gordon, English fashion designer (b. 1863)

heading: Deaths
txt: Jüri Jaakson, Estonian businessman and politician, 6th State Elder of Estonia (b. 1870)

entities.title: Jüri Jaakson
entities.description: Jüri Jaakson VR III/1 was an Estonian businessman and politician.

entities.title: Head of State of Estonia
entities.description: The Head of State of Estonia or State Elder was the official title of the Estonian head of state from 1920 to 1937. He combined some of the functions held by a president and prime minister in most other democracies.

heading: Deaths
txt: Elmer Gedeon, American baseball player and pilot (b. 1917)

entities.title: Elmer Gedeon
entities.description: Elmer John Gedeon was a professional baseball player, appearing in several games for the Washington Senators in 1939. Gedeon and Harry O'Neill were the only two Major League Baseball players killed during World War II. Gedeon flew several missions in the European Theater of Operations as an officer of the United States Army Air Forces before being shot down over France.

heading: Deaths
txt: Erwin Bumke, Polish-German jurist and politician (b. 1874)

entities.title: Erwin Bumke
entities.description: Erwin Konrad Eduard Bumke was the last president of the Reichsgericht, the supreme civil and criminal court of the German Reich, serving from 1929 to 1945. As such, he should according to the Weimar Constitution have succeeded Paul von Hindenburg as the President of Germany upon the latter's death in August 1934 and thus the Head of State of Nazi Germany. The Law on the Head of State of the German

heading: Deaths
txt: Mae Busch, Australian actress (b. 1891)

entities.title: Mae Busch
entities.description: Mae Busch was an Australian-born actress who worked in both silent and sound films in early Hollywood. In the latter part of her career she appeared in many Laurel and Hardy comedies, frequently playing Hardy's shrewish wife.

heading: Deaths
txt: Christian X of Denmark (b. 1870)

entities.title: Christian X of Denmark
entities.description: Christian X was King of Denmark from 1912 to 1947, and the only King of Iceland between 1918 and 1944. He was a member of the House of Glücksburg, a branch of the House of Oldenburg, and the first monarch since King Frederick VII born into the Danish royal family; both his father and his grandfather were born as princes of a ducal family from Schleswig. Among his siblings was King Haakon VII of No

heading: Deaths
txt: Ivanoe Bonomi, Italian politician, 25th Prime Minister of Italy (b. 1873)

entities.title: Ivanoe Bonomi
entities.description: Ivanoe Bonomi [iˈvaːnoe boˈnɔːmi] was an Italian statesman before and after World War II. He served as the 25th Prime Minister of Italy during 1921/22 and again during 1944/45.

entities.title: Prime Minister of Italy
entities.description: The President of the Council of Ministers of the Italian Republic, commonly referred to in Italy as Presidente del Consiglio or informally as Premier, and known in English as the Prime Minister of Italy, is the head of government of the Italian Republic. The office of Prime Minister is established by Articles 92 through 96 of the Constitution of Italy. The Prime Minister is appointed by the Presid

heading: Deaths
txt: Ado Vabbe, Estonian painter (b. 1892)

entities.title: Ado Vabbe
entities.description: Ado Vabbe was an Estonian painter, graphics artist, and teacher.

heading: Deaths
txt: Léo-Paul Desrosiers, Canadian journalist and author (b. 1896)

entities.title: Léo-Paul Desrosiers
entities.description: Léo-Paul Desrosiers was a Quebec writer and journalist well known for his historical novels. He was influenced by the nationalism of Henri Bourassa and Lionel-Adolphe Groulx.

heading: Deaths
txt: Rudolph Dirks, German-American illustrator (b. 1877)

entities.title: Rudolph Dirks
entities.description: Rudolph Dirks was one of the earliest and most noted comic strip artists, well known for The Katzenjammer Kids.

heading: Deaths
txt: Vjekoslav Luburić, Croatian Ustaše official and concentration camp administrator (b. 1914)

entities.title: Vjekoslav Luburić
entities.description: Vjekoslav Luburić was a Croatian Ustaše official who headed the system of concentration camps in the Independent State of Croatia (NDH) during much of World War II. Luburić also personally oversaw and spearheaded the contemporaneous genocides of Serbs, Jews and Roma in the NDH.

entities.title: Ustaše
entities.description: The Ustaša – Croatian Revolutionary Movement, commonly known as Ustaše or by anglicised versions Ustasha or Ustashe, was a Croatian fascist, ultranationalist and terrorist organization, which was active, as one organization, between 1929 and 1945. Its members murdered hundreds of thousands of Serbs, Jews, and Roma as well as political dissidents in Yugoslavia during World War II.

heading: Deaths
txt: M. Canagaratnam, Sri Lankan politician (b. 1924)

entities.title: M. Canagaratnam
entities.description: Mylvaganam Canagaratnam was a Sri Lankan Tamil politician and Member of Parliament.

heading: Deaths
txt: Archibald MacLeish, American poet, playwright, and lawyer (b. 1892)

entities.title: Archibald MacLeish
entities.description: Archibald MacLeish was an American poet and writer, who was associated with the modernist school of poetry. MacLeish studied English at Yale University and law at Harvard University. He enlisted in and saw action during the First World War and lived in Paris in the 1920s. On returning to the United States, he contributed to Henry Luce's magazine Fortune from 1929 to 1938. For five years, MacLeish

heading: Deaths
txt: Sibte Hassan, Pakistani journalist, scholar, and activist (b. 1916)

entities.title: Sibte Hassan
entities.description: Syed Sibt-e-Hasan was an eminent scholar, journalist and political activist of Pakistan. He is regarded as one of the pioneers of Socialism and Marxism in Pakistan, as well as the moving spirit behind the Progressive Writers Association.

heading: Deaths
txt: Steve Marriott, English singer-songwriter and producer (b. 1947)

entities.title: Steve Marriott
entities.description: Stephen Peter Marriott was an English musician, songwriter and frontman guitarist of rock bands Small Faces and Humble Pie, spanning over two decades. Marriott was inducted posthumously into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2012 as a member of Small Faces.

heading: Deaths
txt: Don Siegel, American director and producer (b. 1912)

heading: Deaths
txt: Marjorie Gestring, American springboard diver (b. 1922)

entities.title: Marjorie Gestring
entities.description: Marjorie Gestring was a competitive springboard diver from the United States. At the age of 13 years and 268 days, she won the gold medal in 3-meter springboard diving at the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin, making her, at the time, the youngest person ever to win an Olympic gold medal. A multi-time national diving champion in the United States, she was given a second Olympic gold medal by the Unit

heading: Deaths
txt: Benny Hill, English comedian, actor, and screenwriter (b. 1924)

heading: Deaths
txt: Cantinflas, Mexican actor, producer, and screenwriter (b. 1911)

entities.title: Cantinflas
entities.description: Mario Fortino Alfonso Moreno Reyes, known by the stage name Cantinflas, was a Mexican comedian, actor, and filmmaker. He is considered to have been the most widely-accomplished Mexican comedian and is celebrated throughout Latin America and in Spain as a popular icon. His humor, loaded with Mexican linguistic features of intonation, vocabulary, and syntax, is beloved in all the Spanish-speaking co

heading: Deaths
txt: Milovan Đilas, Yugoslav communist, politician, theorist and author (b. 1911)

entities.title: Milovan Đilas
entities.description: Milovan Đilas was a Yugoslav communist politician, theorist and author. He was a key figure in the Partisan movement during World War II, as well as in the post-war government. A self-identified democratic socialist, Đilas became one of the best-known and most prominent dissidents in Yugoslavia and all of Eastern Europe.

heading: Deaths
txt: Trần Văn Trà, Vietnamese general and politician (b. 1918)

entities.title: Trần Văn Trà
entities.description: Nguyễn Chấn, known as Trần Văn Trà was a Vietnamese general. He was a commander in the Vietcong; a member of the Central Committee of the Lao Dong Party from 1960 to 1982; a lieutenant general in the army of the North Vietnam; chairman of Military Affairs Committee of the Central Office of South Vietnam (COSVN) (1964–1976).

heading: Deaths
txt: Giuseppe Sinopoli, Italian conductor and composer (b. 1946)

entities.title: Giuseppe Sinopoli
entities.description: Giuseppe Sinopoli was an Italian conductor and composer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Alan Dale, American singer (b. 1925)

entities.title: Alan Dale (singer)
entities.description: Alan Dale was an American singer of traditional popular and rock and roll music.

heading: Deaths
txt: Bernard Katz, German-English biophysicist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1911)

entities.title: Bernard Katz
entities.description: Sir Bernard Katz, FRS was a German-born British physician and biophysicist, noted for his work on nerve physiology. He shared the Nobel Prize in physiology or medicine in 1970 with Julius Axelrod and Ulf von Euler. He was made a Knight Bachelor in 1969.

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine is awarded yearly by the Nobel Assembly at the Karolinska Institutet for outstanding discoveries in physiology or medicine.

heading: Deaths
txt: Lizzy Mercier Descloux, French musician, singer-songwriter, composer, actress, writer and painter (b. 1956)

entities.title: Lizzy Mercier Descloux
entities.description: Martine-Elisabeth "Lizzy" Mercier Descloux was a French musician, singer-songwriter, composer, actress, writer and painter.

heading: Deaths
txt: Fumio Niwa, Japanese journalist and author (b. 1904)

entities.title: Fumio Niwa
entities.description: Fumio Niwa  was a Japanese novelist with a long list of works, the most famous in the West being his novel The Buddha Tree.

heading: Deaths
txt: Andrew Hill, American pianist, composer, and bandleader (b. 1931)

entities.title: Andrew Hill (jazz musician)
entities.description: Andrew Hill was an American jazz pianist and composer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Michael Fu Tieshan, Chinese bishop (b. 1931)

heading: Deaths
txt: Monica Lovinescu, Romanian journalist and author (b. 1923)

entities.title: Monica Lovinescu
entities.description: Monica Lovinescu was a Romanian essayist, short story writer, literary critic, translator, and journalist, noted for her activities as an opponent of the Romanian Communist regime. She published several works under the pseudonyms Monique Saint-Come and Claude Pascal. She is the daughter of literary figure Eugen Lovinescu. She was married to the literary critic Virgil Ierunca.

heading: Deaths
txt: Dorothy Height, American educator and activist (b. 1912)

entities.title: Dorothy Height
entities.description: Dorothy Irene Height was an African American civil rights and women's rights activist. She focused on the issues of African American women, including unemployment, illiteracy, and voter awareness. Height is credited as the first leader in the civil rights movement to recognize inequality for women and African Americans as problems that should be considered as a whole. heading: Deaths
txt: Tim Hetherington, English photographer and journalist (b. 1970)

entities.title: Tim Hetherington
entities.description: Timothy Alistair Telemachus Hetherington was a British photojournalist. He produced books, films and other work that "ranged from multi-screen installations, to fly-poster exhibitions, to handheld device downloads" and was a regular contributor to Vanity Fair.

heading: Deaths
txt: Bert Weedon, English guitarist and songwriter (b. 1920)

entities.title: Bert Weedon
entities.description: Herbert Maurice William 'Bert' Weedon, OBE was an English guitarist whose style of playing was popular and influential during the 1950s and 1960s. He was the first British guitarist to have a hit record in the UK Singles Chart, in 1959, and his best-selling tutorial guides, Play in a Day, were a major influence on many leading British musicians, such as Eric Clapton, Brian May and Paul McCartney.

heading: Deaths
txt: Victoria Wood, British comedian, actress and writer (b. 1953)

entities.title: Victoria Wood
entities.description: Victoria Wood was an English comedian, actress, lyricist, singer, composer, pianist, screenwriter, producer and director.

heading: Deaths
txt: Avicii, Swedish DJ and musician (b. 1989)

entities.title: Avicii
entities.description: Tim Bergling, known by his stage name Avicii, was a Swedish DJ, remixer, record producer, musician, and songwriter.

heading: Deaths
txt: Idriss Déby, Chadian politician and military officer (b. 1952)

entities.title: Idriss Déby
entities.description: Idriss Déby Itno was a Chadian politician and military officer, and head of the ruling Patriotic Salvation Movement, who was the president of Chad from 1990 until his death at the hands of militant forces when commanding troops on the front in 2021.
